description.narrative:
The project title #Youth Rights Accountability Initiative# planned for seven months in Takhar to empower youth to take independent decisions and heard their voices. Young people in Takhar face significant challenges related to education, employment and gender inequality, which put youth in dire consequences. Unemployment and low levels of education have led to an increase in drug addiction, early marriage and early pregnancy are widespread, and radicalization and extremism, illegal migration are a growing phenomenon. The youth are not aware of their rights as per the youth policy, so the accountability is poor. Almost all youth in urban and rural settings are unaware of the service delivery that Deputy Ministry of Youth Affairs (DMoYA) is delivering as per the youth policy.
This project will put in practice the right based approach to work with 1180 direct beneficiaries including 50% female#youth, and 40% indirect beneficiaries across all the districts of Takhar (as per TV broadcasting coverage to 40%population of Takhar). With the two project outputs, this project will initially train the project staff on the national youth policy and evidence based advocacy. A provincial youth participation study to map existing youth structures, identify the youthstrategic issues and capacity gaps. A Takhar Youth Parliament (TYP) will be setup, with governing bylaws, and Operational and Ethical Manual or its operations. Four trainings will be organized to train AYP members in youth development strategy, leadership, good governance and advocacy and accountability. Five Monthly Interactive Dialogues (MIDs) and four advocacy meetings will be organized for the TYP and with relevant government departments specifically Deputy Ministry of Youth Affairs. The members will be guided to share back the findings of the discussion with youthand community elders in public places and gatherings. In during each MID, the policy implementation gaps and youth issues will be segregated for the advocacy with the relevant departments. Once the MID is conducted, in the same month, HODA will facilitate membersto organize the advocacy meetings with relevant departments. Total four advocacy meetings will be undertaken in the project life time. A joint follow-up strategy will be designedwith the government and will be executed by the members until satisfactory solutions proposed. The results of the follow up will be shared back in the next MID meeting and with communities through community outreach sessions. A social media page will bedesigned for the TYP to disseminate project progress and provide information on the youth issues and opportunities available.

participating-org.narrative: Hoda-e-Sharq Organization For Developing Afghanistan is non-governmental, non-profit and independent organization that was established in Takhar Province on 1388/11/10 Solar year and it is officially registered in ministry of economy of Afghanistan vide registration number (1603) HODA#s has been implementing activities both national and international organization . Being a national non-governmental organization, HODA is committed and dedicate to fight against poverty and eliminating of suffering of the poor communities in Afghanistan particularly women. HODA places especially focus on working with poor women, because of their inaccessibility to proper resources and strive to empower women as it helps whole family and entire community to escape form the clutches of poverty. Women are at the heart of HODA community-based efforts to improve basic education, prevent the spread of diseases, increase access to basic resource, develop economic opportunities and protect natural reassure. HODA also deliver emergency aid to survivors of war and natural disasters, and helps people rebuild their lives.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
